intro: Podolobium bidwellianum, commonly known as Bidwell's podolobium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a slender stem, trifoliate leaves, and small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological adaptations.
